title: Create my-values.yaml
content:
You need to create a my-values.yaml file with the configuration information for your UD/UCMDB deployment.

When creating the my-values.yaml file, keep the following in mind:

  • You need to set the global.externalAccessPort parameter to the port for UD/UCMDB.
  • You need to set the global.externalAccessHost parameter to the FQDN for UD/UCMDB.
  • As UD/UCMDB is installed as the next deployment of Service Management,you need to use the shared IdM (suite IdM) to manage UD/UCMDB users. To do this, make sure that the global.idm.internal parameter to false. Additionally, you also need to configure the parameters as described in the Service Management integration parameters section.

Create and configure my-values.yaml

You can create and configure a custom my-values.yaml file based on the sample file (values-with-smax.yaml) provided in the UD/UCMDB chart package.

  1. Create a copy of the values-with-smax.yaml sample file.

    cp UCMDB_Helm_Chart-2x.x/ucmdb-helm-charts/samples/values-with-smax.yaml my-values.yaml

  2. Edit the my-values.yaml file using any editor and provide the required values in the file.

This my-values.yaml file contains critical configuration information. Many administrative operations are based on this file, for example, UD/UCMDB version upgrade, enable TLS connection to databases. The file must be securely stored and backed up regularly.

Configurable parameters

The configurable parameters supported by the UD/UCMDB chart are grouped into the following categories.

Generic parameters

Parameter Required Description Default Example
acceptEula Yes You must accept EULA to deploy UD/UCMDB false true
global.docker.registry No Docker registry where UD/UCMDB docker images are stored.
 
If the external registry is used, set it to the URL of the external registry, otherwise, leave it as is.		 localhost:5000 External registry: registry.example.
com:443
global.docker.orgName No Docker organization name hpeswitom hpeswitom
global.securityContext.user No

This parameter specifies the operating system user ID that is used to run the process in the container.

The value of this parameter and the ID of the NFS folder owner (the value of <user> when creating the UD/UCMDB NFS volumes) must be the same. For example, if you use 100001 instead of 1999 when creating NFS, you must also use 100001 as the value for this parameter. 
The value can't be changed after installation.
 1999 100001
global.securityContext.fsGroup No

This parameter specifies the operating system group ID that is used to run the process in the container.

The value of this parameter and the group ID (the value of <fsGroup> when creating the UD/UCMDB NFS volumes) must be the same. For example, if you use 200001 instead of 1999 when creating NFS, you must also use 200001 as the value for this parameter. 
The value can't be changed after installation.
 1999 200001
global.nodeSelector No

This parameter specifies the nodes to run the process in the container. Set the corresponding node selector tags if you want the UD/UCMDB services to run only on the specified nodes.

The label specified here must be the same as the label of the worker node created for UD/UCMDB.

 Worker: label Worker: ucmdb

Shared IdM parameters

For better user management between Service Management and UD/UCMDB, configure the following parameters for UD/UCMDB to use the suite IdM ("shared IdM") to manage UD/UCMDB users.

Parameter Required Description Default Example
global.idm.internal Yes This parameter specifies whether UD/UCMDB uses internal IdM or external IdM. When UD/UCMDB is deployed with Service Management, the value must be false for UD/UCMDB to use suite IdM as the shared IdM. false false
global.idm.idmAuthUrl Yes URL that's used by suite applications to redirect the browser to the IdM login screen. https://<SMA-FQDN>:443/idm-service
global.idm.idmServiceUrl Yes URL that's used by suite applications to communicate with IdM, such as requesting the request token, calling IdM APIs, etc. https://<SMA-FQDN>:443/idm-service
global.idm.idmIntegrationAdmin Yes Name of the UD/UCMDB integration admin user name created in Create UD/UCMDB integration admin user in the suite IdM. ucmdb-integration-admin
global.idm.tenant Yes IdM tenant organization name that's mapped to UD/UCMDB Provider Customer, which is only used for non-business management, so the value should be sysbo. sysbo sysbo

Networking parameters

The networking configuration parameters are set differently based on whether a load balancer is set up for accessing UD/UCMDB user interfaces.

  • With a load balancer for accessing UD/UCMDB user interface

    Parameter Required Description Default Example
    global.externalAccessHost Yes Set the value to the FQDN of the load balancer. ucmdb.example.com
    global.externalAccessPort Yes Set the value to the listening port on the load balancer for accessing UD/UCMDB user interfaces. 9443 3443
    itom-ingress-controller.nginx.service.httpsPort No Set it to a value that doesn't conflict with other applications deployed in the same cluster. For example, if Service Management and UD/UCMDB are deployed in the same cluster, this parameter must be set to a value different than Service Management.
     
    If the parameter isn't set, it will take the value of the global.externalAccessPort parameter.

  • Without a load balancer for accessing UD/UCMDB user interfaces

    This setup applies to single-control plane node deployment only.
    Parameter Required Description Default Example
    global.externalAccessHost Yes Set the value to the FQDN of the control plane node. ucmdb.example.com
    global.externalAccessPort Yes Set it to a value that doesn't conflict with other applications deployed in the same cluster. For example, if Service Management and UD/UCMDB are deployed in the same cluster, this parameter must be set to a value different than Service Management. 9443 3443
    itom-ingress-controller.nginx.service.httpsPort No Don't set any value for this parameter.

Database parameters

Configure the following parameters. 

Parameter Required Description Default Example
global.database.host Yes Database server host name db.example.com
global.database.port Yes Database server port 5432
ucmdbserver.deployment.database.user Yes UCMDB database user ucmdb ucmdb
ucmdbserver.deployment.database.dbName Yes UCMDB database name ucmdb ucmdb_db
ucmdbserver.deployment.database.schema Yes UCMDB database schema ucmdb ucmdb_schema
autopass.deployment.database.user Yes AutoPass database user autopass ucmdb_autopass
autopass.deployment.database.dbName Yes AutoPass database name autopass ucmdb_autopass_db
autopass.deployment.database.schema No AutoPass database schema public ucmdb_autopass_schema

TLS parameters for external PostgreSQL

If you want to connect to the external PostgreSQL by using TLS, configure the following parameters:

Parameter Required Description Default Example
global.database.tlsEnabled No

Enable TLS connection to database server.

Set it to true if you want to enable TLS.

 false true
caCertificates No The content of the database server CA certificate encoded by base-64.

If your certificate isn't base-64 encoded, run the following command on a Linux system to encode the CA certificate:

base64 < pg-ca.pem

caCertificates:
  database.cert: |
    <certificate content
    base-64 encoded>

See the screenshot below.
ucmdbserver.deployment.
database.tlsCert		 No

(Required when tlsEnabled is true) The name of the key for
the PostgreSQLcertificate defined in the
 caCertificates parameter.

Note: You need to manually insert this parameter in
the my-values.yaml file.

 database.cert
ucmdbprobe.deployment.
database.tlsCert		 No

(Required when tlsEnabled is true and global.cms.deployProbe is true) The name of the key for
the external PostgreSQL database certificate defined
in the caCertificates parameter.

Note: You need to manually insert this parameter in
the my-values.yaml file.

 probe-postgresql.crt

For more information about the PostgreSQL CA certificate, see Enable TLS connections to external PostgreSQL.

Data Flow Probe database parameters

If you plan to deploy UD/UCMDB with the containerized Data Flow Probe, you need to configure the following database parameters, otherwise, skip them.

Parameter Required Description Default Example
ucmdbprobe.deployment.database.
probeEmbeddedDb		 No
  • true (default): The PostgreSQL database embedded in the containerized Data Flow Probe is used
  • false: The external PostgreSQL database is used by the containerized Data Flow Probe 
 true false
ucmdbprobe.deployment.database.user No Data Flow Probe database user. Required when probeEmbeddedDb is false. probe ucmdb_probe
ucmdbprobe.deployment.database.dbName No Data Flow Probe database name. Required when probeEmbeddedDb is false. dataflowprobe ucmdb_probe_db
ucmdbprobe.deployment.database.schema No Data Flow Probe database schema. Required when probeEmbeddedDb is false. probe ucmdb_probe_schema

Persistence parameters

Parameter Required Description Default Example
global.persistence.enabled No Enables dynamic PVC creation.
 
In production environments, this parameter must be set to true.		 true true
global.persistence.dataVolumeName Yes

Persistent volume (PV) for storing UD/UCMDB data files.

In this release, you must uncomment this parameter with the default value in my-values.yaml to explicitly specify dataVolumeName: ucmdb-data-volume
 cms-data-volume ucmdb-data-volume
global.persistence.configVolumeName Yes

Persistent volume (PV) for storing UD/UCMDB configuration files.

In this release, you must uncomment this parameter with the default value in my-values.yaml to explicitly specify configVolumeName: ucmdb-config-volume
 cms-config-volume ucmdb-config-volume
global.persistence.logVolumeName Yes

Persistent volume (PV) for storing UD/UCMDB log files.

In this release, you must uncomment this parameter with the default value in my-values.yaml to explicitly specify logVolumeName: ucmdb-log-volume
 cms-log-volume ucmdb-log-volume
global.persistence.dataVolumeStorageClassName No

The storage class name of the automatically created PVC for UD/UCMDB data files. The value must be the same as the storageClassName defined in the corresponding PV.
global.persistence.configVolumeStorageClassName No

The storage class name of the automatically created PVC for UD/UCMDB configuration files. The value must be the same as the storageClassName defined in the corresponding PV.
global.persistence.logVolumeStorageClassName No

The storage class name of the automatically created PVC for UD/UCMDB log files. The value must be the same as the storageClassName defined in the corresponding PV.
global.persistence.dataVolumeSize No The requested storage size of the automatically created PVC for UD/UCMDB data files. 5G
global.persistence.configVolumeSize No The requested storage size of the automatically created PVC for UD/UCMDB configuration files. 5G
global.persistence.logVolumeSize No The requested storage size of the automatically created PVC for UD/UCMDB log files. 5G

UD/UCMDB deployment parameters

Parameter Required Description Default Example
global.size Yes Deployment size of UD/UCMDB application (small/medium/large) small small
global.cms.timeZone No The time zone used in timestamps of messages produced in UD/UCMDB log files.
 
The time zones have unique names in the form Area/Location. The supported values are described in this website: List of tz database time zones		 UTC Asia/Shanghai
global.cms.deployProbe No Deploy the Data Flow Probe in the OMT cluster if true. true false
global.cms.deployGateway No

Deploy the UCMDB Gateway in the OMT cluster if true.

By default, this parameter isn't listed in the sample file, and the system uses the default value (true). This is because the component is required when you deploy UD/UCMDB with Service Management. Don't manually set this parameter to false.

 true true
global.cms.deployDownloader No

Deploy the Data Flow Probe installers, the Local Client installers, and the UCMDB API Client jar files for downloading in the OMT cluster if true. 

By default, this parameter isn't listed in the sample file, and the system uses the default value (true). It's recommended that you keep the default value and deploy the component without manually setting the parameter to false.

If you want to disable the Help > Download menu, set the value to false. 

 true true

UD/UCMDB audit integration parameters

If you want to enable the Audit service for UD/UCMDB, you need to add the following parameters under the IdM component. 

Parameter Required Description Default Example
auditEngineHostname Yes The hostname of the audit service deployment.  Null. You need to set the value. audit.example.com
auditEnginePort Yes The port in which you deploy the audit service. Null. You need to set the value. 9889
auditIntegrationUser Yes The audit integration user that you use to create audits. The user must be the System type and have the CREATE_AUDIT permission to create audit data. Null. You need to set the value. suite-admin
auditNfsPath Yes The path to store audits when audits don't get pushed to the audit engine. var/nfs/audit example/nfs/audit
caCertificates Yes

The content of the audit CA certificate encoded by base-64.

Get the certificate from the Audit service engine:

  1. Open the Audit engine URL in a web browser: https://<auditEngineHostname>:<auditEnginePort>/audit-gateway?TENANTID=<tenantId>
  2. Download the .pem file.
  3. Convert the .pem extension to .crt. 
    openssl x509 -outform der -in audit_gateway.pem -out audit_gateway.crt

caCertificates:
  audit.crt: |
    <certificate content
    base-64 encoded>  

See the screenshot below.

Service Management integration parameters

If you use shared IdM, or if you want to set up Native SACM or enable SAM in Service Management, you must configure the following parameters.

Parameter Required Description Default Example
cmsgateway.deployment.smax.host Yes The FQDN of the load balancer for accessing the Service Management APIs smax.example.com
cmsgateway.deployment.smax.port Yes The listening port on the load balancer for accessing the Service Management APIs 443 443

cmsgateway.deployment.sam.host

 (For SAM only) Yes The FQDN of the load balancer for accessing the SAM APIs. The value of this parameter is the same as that of the cmsgateway.deployment.smax.host parameter. smax.example.com

cmsgateway.deployment.sam.port

(For SAM only) Yes

The port of the load balancer for accessing the SAM APIs. The value of this parameter is the same as that of the cmsgateway.deployment.smax.port parameter.

443

443

cmsgateway.deployment.sam.context

(For SAM only) Yes

The context path of SAM. Set this parameter to sam/urest.

sam/urest

sam/urest
caCertificates Yes

The content of the Service Management CA certificate encoded by base-64.

To get the content of the Service Management CA certificate, see Get the suite CA certificate.

You must keep the original format of the certificate without adding any spaces or changing the indentation.

Example:

caCertificates:
  smax.crt: |
    <certificate content base-64 encoded>
